TopicTitle: Z-Map Satellite launch kit has no attitude control

Articles.Content:
Z-Map Satellite launch kit has no attitude control
It flies fine in atmo, but once in space... 
No reaction wheel. At all.

It's a legacy build back from when the Octo2 had reaction wheels. It's controllable as long as the LV-909 is attached since you can use the thrust vectoring to reorient but as soon as you separate, the ant engine won't give you any control.

Edited April 21, 2016 by Reactordrone
Solution - add a separate reaction wheel.
